snippet: The gunmen stormed a school in Peshawar, killing more than 100 students, along with teachers, during an eight-hour rampage in retaliation against the military, officials said.
abstract: Taliban gunmen attack military school in Peshawar, Pakistan, killing 145 people, including 132 schoolchildren, in worst single attack in group's history; militants with suicide vests die during eight-hour siege at Army Public School and Degree College; Taliban says attack is retaliation against Pakistani military.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ismail Khan and Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from Peshawar, Pakistan; Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan; and Eric Schmitt and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The gunmen stormed a school in Peshawar, killing more than 100 students, along with teachers, during an eight-hour rampage in retaliation against the military, officials said.

headline.main: Taliban Besiege Pakistan School, Leaving 145 Dead
headline.print_headline: Taliban Besiege Pakistan School, Leaving 145 Dead

keywords.value: Army Public School and Degree College (Peshawar, Pakistan)
